security: Revealing details of the ALIMUOO/1 operation and the proposed recruitment of specific individuals who received guerrilla warfare training in Cuba could compromise ongoing intelligence activities, endanger involved personnel, and damage relations with the Guatemalan government. Quoting directly: 'Special treatment should be given to the Caro Astatigo and the Chao Hombres Banas...Every effort should be made to identify the last-named person and then to recruit all four of them.'
summary: This memorandum discusses a meeting with Colonel Porres regarding the ALIMUOO/1 Operation, focusing on the recruitment of specific individuals trained in Cuba and actions to be taken by the Guatemalan government.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated October 13, 1964, outlines discussions from a meeting with Colonel Porres concerning the ALIMUOO/1 Operation, with Andy Rogers of the Guatemalan Station also present. The meeting addressed the recruitment of individuals associated with the 'Caro Astatigo' and 'Chao Hombres Banas,' including Lyon Sosa, Luis Augusto Turcios Lima, Manuel Joue Ortega Paz, and an unidentified individual, all believed to have received guerrilla warfare training in Cuba. Plans included identifying, recruiting, and gathering information on these individuals, as well as using a Cuban intelligence officer to make contact under controlled conditions. The memorandum also details efforts by the Guatemalan government to locate, arrest, and publicize the arrests of individuals who received guerrilla warfare training in Cuba, aiming to exploit their involvement for propaganda purposes.
title: ALIMUOO/1 Operation: Meeting with Colonel Porres
